tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE vulnerability_tracking (
    vulnerability_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    vulnerability_name VARCHAR(255),
    severity_level VARCHAR(50),
    detection_date DATE,
    vulnerability_description TEXT,
    affected_system VARCHAR(100),
    remediation_steps TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE vulnerabilities (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    description TEXT,
    severity ENUM('low', 'medium', 'high'),
    finding_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerability_reports (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    vulnerability_id INT,
    report_date DATE,
    reported_by VARCHAR(100),
    summary TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (vulnerability_id) REFERENCES vulnerabilities(id)
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerabilities (
    vulnerability_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    vulnerability_name STRING,
    severity ENUM('LOW', 'MEDIUM', 'HIGH'),
    description STRING,
    target_host STRING,
    found_by STRING,
    date_discovered DATE
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerability_impact (
    impact_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    vulnerability_id UUID REFERENCES vulnerabilities(vulnerability_id),
    impact_description STRING,
    affected_assets ARRAY<STRING>,
    remediation_plan STRING
);

CREATE TABLE findings (
    finding_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    vulnerability_id UUID REFERENCES vulnerabilities(vulnerability_id),
    finding_details STRING,
    risk_level ENUM('LOW', 'MEDIUM', 'HIGH'),
    finding_status ENUM('OPEN', 'CLOSED'),
    date_reported DATE
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username STRING UNIQUE,
    full_name STRING,
    email STRING UNIQUE,
    role ENUM('ADMIN', 'ANALYST', 'ENGINEER'),
    date_joined DATE
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerabilities (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    vulnerability_name TEXT NOT NULL,
    severity TEXT DEFAULT 'Low',
    description TEXT,
    affected_system TEXT,
    date_discovered DATE
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerability_reports (
    report_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    vulnerability_id INT,
    report_date DATE,
    report_text TEXT,
    reported_by TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (vulnerability_id) REFERENCES vulnerabilities(id)
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerability_scanners (
    scanner_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    scanner_name TEXT NOT NULL,
    scanner_type TEXT,
    scanner_version TEXT,
    scanner_vendor TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerable_systems (
    system_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    system_name TEXT NOT NULL,
    ip_address TEXT,
    operating_system TEXT,
    description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE vulnerability_scans (
    scan_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    scanner_id INT,
    system_id INT,
    scan_date DATE,
    scan_results TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (scanner_id) REFERENCES vulnerability_scanners(scanner_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (system_id) REFERENCES vulnerable_systems(system_id)
);
